name: ISO 27001
fullName: ISO/IEC 27001:2022 â€” Information Security Management Systems
description: ISO/IEC 27001 is the international gold standard for establishing, implementing, maintaining, and continually improving an Information Security Management System (ISMS). It requires a systemic approach to managing sensitive company information through continuous risk assessment and risk treatment. The 2022 revision consolidated 114 controls into 93 across 4 domains.

lifecycle.name: ISMS Planning & Context
lifecycle.description: Develop ISMS implementation plan using PDCA lifecycle. Define organizational context, interested parties, and ISMS scope.

lifecycle.name: Asset Inventory & Risk Assessment
lifecycle.description: Conduct thorough inventory of all information assets. Establish risk assessment methodology. Identify vulnerabilities and calculate risk.

lifecycle.name: Risk Treatment & SoA
lifecycle.description: Select risk treatment options. Map Annex A controls to identified risks. Create Statement of Applicability (SoA).

lifecycle.name: Control Implementation
lifecycle.description: Implement selected Annex A controls. Develop policies, procedures, and technical configurations.

lifecycle.name: Internal Audit & Management Review
lifecycle.description: Conduct internal audit of ISMS effectiveness. Present findings to leadership for management review.

lifecycle.name: Stage 1 & Stage 2 External Audit
lifecycle.description: Stage 1: Documentation review. Stage 2: Implementation verification by accredited certification body.

lifecycle.name: Continual Improvement
lifecycle.description: Maintain ISMS through surveillance audits, corrective actions, and triennial recertification.

domains.name: A.5: Organizational Controls
domains.description: Leadership, governance, and strategy controls that establish the organizational framework for information security.

controls.name: Policies for Information Security
controls.description: Information security policy and topic-specific policies shall be defined, approved by management, published, communicated to and acknowledged by relevant personnel and relevant interested parties, and reviewed at planned intervals or if significant changes occur.
controls.implementationGuidance: Create a master information security policy with topic-specific sub-policies. Store in Git for version control. Require annual review and employee acknowledgment.

controls.name: Information Security Roles and Responsibilities
controls.description: Information security roles and responsibilities shall be defined and allocated.
controls.implementationGuidance: Define RACI matrix for security responsibilities. Appoint CISO or equivalent. Document roles in job descriptions.

controls.name: Segregation of Duties
controls.description: Conflicting duties and conflicting areas of responsibility shall be segregated.
controls.implementationGuidance: Identify conflicting duties (e.g., developer vs deployer). Implement separation in CI/CD pipelines. Document segregation matrix.

controls.name: Threat Intelligence
controls.description: Information relating to information security threats shall be collected and analysed to produce threat intelligence.
controls.implementationGuidance: Subscribe to threat intelligence feeds. Monitor CVE databases. Integrate threat intel into risk assessment process.

controls.name: Information Security in Project Management
controls.description: Information security shall be integrated into project management.
controls.implementationGuidance: Include security review gates in project lifecycle. Require threat modeling for new features. Add security acceptance criteria to user stories.

controls.name: Classification of Information
controls.description: Information shall be classified according to the information security needs of the organization based on confidentiality, integrity, availability and relevant interested party requirements.
controls.implementationGuidance: Define classification levels (Public, Internal, Confidential, Restricted). Apply labels to data stores and documents.

controls.name: Access Control
controls.description: Rules to control physical and logical access to information and other associated assets shall be established and implemented based on business and information security requirements.
controls.implementationGuidance: Implement RBAC. Enforce least privilege. Conduct quarterly access reviews. Use SSO where feasible.

controls.name: Information Security in Supplier Relationships
controls.description: Processes and procedures shall be defined and implemented to manage the information security risks associated with the use of supplier's products or services.
controls.implementationGuidance: Maintain vendor inventory. Assess vendor security posture. Include security requirements in contracts. Review vendor risk annually.

controls.name: Information Security Incident Management Planning and Preparation
controls.description: The organization shall plan and prepare for managing information security incidents by defining, establishing and communicating information security incident management processes, roles and responsibilities.
controls.implementationGuidance: Develop incident response plan with clear roles. Define severity levels. Establish communication protocols. Test annually.

controls.name: Information Security During Disruption
controls.description: The organization shall plan how to maintain information security at an appropriate level during disruption.
controls.implementationGuidance: Include information security in business continuity plans. Define security procedures for crisis situations. Test failover security.

domains.name: A.6: People Controls
domains.description: Controls ensuring a resilient cybersecurity culture through personnel security measures.

controls.name: Screening
controls.description: Background verification checks on all candidates to become personnel shall be carried out prior to joining the organization and on an ongoing basis.
controls.implementationGuidance: Conduct background checks for all new hires. Implement ongoing screening for sensitive roles.

controls.name: Terms and Conditions of Employment
controls.description: Employment contractual agreements shall state the personnel's and the organization's responsibilities for information security.
controls.implementationGuidance: Include security obligations in employment contracts. Define NDA requirements. Specify acceptable use terms.

controls.name: Information Security Awareness, Education and Training
controls.description: Personnel of the organization and relevant interested parties shall receive appropriate information security awareness education and training.
controls.implementationGuidance: Implement annual security awareness training. Conduct phishing simulations. Provide role-specific training for developers and admins.

controls.name: Disciplinary Process
controls.description: A disciplinary process shall be formalized and communicated to take actions against personnel who have committed an information security policy violation.
controls.implementationGuidance: Define graduated disciplinary process for security violations. Document and communicate consequences.

controls.name: Responsibilities After Termination or Change of Employment
controls.description: Information security responsibilities and duties that remain valid after termination or change of employment shall be defined, enforced and communicated.
controls.implementationGuidance: Define offboarding procedures. Revoke access immediately on termination. Enforce post-employment obligations.

controls.name: Information Security Event Reporting
controls.description: The organization shall provide a mechanism for personnel to report observed or suspected information security events through appropriate channels in a timely manner.
controls.implementationGuidance: Provide clear reporting channels (email, ticketing, hotline). Train staff on what constitutes a security event. Mandate timely reporting.

domains.name: A.7: Physical Controls
domains.description: Protection of IT assets, facilities, and physical infrastructure.

controls.name: Physical Security Perimeters
controls.description: Security perimeters shall be defined and used to protect areas that contain information and other associated assets.
controls.implementationGuidance: Define physical security zones. Implement badge access. Deploy surveillance cameras. Maintain visitor logs.

controls.name: Physical Security Monitoring
controls.description: Premises shall be continuously monitored for unauthorized physical access.
controls.implementationGuidance: Install CCTV systems. Implement intrusion detection sensors. Monitor 24/7. Retain footage per policy.

controls.name: Storage Media
controls.description: Storage media shall be managed through their life cycle of acquisition, use, transportation and disposal in accordance with the organization's classification scheme.
controls.implementationGuidance: Track all storage media. Implement secure disposal procedures. Encrypt portable media. Log media movements.

domains.name: A.8: Technological Controls
domains.description: Robust defense controls for systems, networks, and technical infrastructure.

controls.name: User Endpoint Devices
controls.description: Information stored on, processed by or accessible via user endpoint devices shall be protected.
controls.implementationGuidance: Deploy MDM/endpoint protection. Enforce full-disk encryption. Require screen lock. Push OS and application updates.

controls.name: Privileged Access Rights
controls.description: The allocation and use of privileged access rights shall be restricted and managed.
controls.implementationGuidance: Implement PAM (Privileged Access Management). Use just-in-time admin access. Log all privileged operations. Review quarterly.

controls.name: Information Access Restriction
controls.description: Access to information and other associated assets shall be restricted in accordance with the established topic-specific policy on access control.
controls.implementationGuidance: Implement data-level access controls. Restrict API endpoints by role. Enforce need-to-know access to databases.

controls.name: Secure Authentication
controls.description: Secure authentication technologies and procedures shall be established and implemented based on information access restrictions and the topic-specific policy on access control.
controls.implementationGuidance: Enforce MFA for all systems. Use strong password policies. Implement SSO. Prohibit default credentials.

controls.name: Protection Against Malware
controls.description: Protection against malware shall be implemented and supported by appropriate user awareness.
controls.implementationGuidance: Deploy EDR/antimalware on all endpoints. Enable real-time scanning. Update signatures automatically. Alert on detections.

controls.name: Management of Technical Vulnerabilities
controls.description: Information about technical vulnerabilities of information systems in use shall be obtained, the organization's exposure to such vulnerabilities shall be evaluated and appropriate measures shall be taken.
controls.implementationGuidance: Conduct regular vulnerability scans. Prioritize by CVSS score. Remediate critical/high within SLA. Track in ticketing system.

controls.name: Configuration Management
controls.description: Configurations, including security configurations, of hardware, software, services and networks shall be established, documented, implemented, monitored and reviewed.
controls.implementationGuidance: Define secure baselines using CIS benchmarks. Implement configuration management (Ansible, Terraform). Monitor for config drift.

controls.name: Data Masking
controls.description: Data masking shall be used in accordance with the organization's topic-specific policy on access control and other related topic-specific policies, and business requirements, taking applicable legislation into consideration.
controls.implementationGuidance: Implement dynamic data masking for non-production environments. Mask PII in logs. Use tokenization for sensitive data.

controls.name: Logging
controls.description: Logs that record activities, exceptions, faults and other relevant events shall be produced, stored, protected and analysed.
controls.implementationGuidance: Implement centralized logging (ELK, Splunk, CloudWatch). Log authentication events, access changes, and admin actions. Protect log integrity.

controls.name: Networks Security
controls.description: Networks and network devices shall be secured, managed and controlled to protect information in systems and applications.
controls.implementationGuidance: Implement network segmentation. Deploy firewalls and WAFs. Monitor network traffic. Restrict management access.

controls.name: Use of Cryptography
controls.description: Rules for the effective use of cryptography, including cryptographic key management, shall be defined and implemented.
controls.implementationGuidance: Enforce AES-256 for data at rest. Require TLS 1.2+ for data in transit. Implement key management procedures. Rotate keys per policy.

controls.name: Secure Development Life Cycle
controls.description: Rules for the secure development of software and systems shall be established and applied.
controls.implementationGuidance: Integrate SAST/DAST into CI/CD pipelines. Require peer code review. Conduct threat modeling. Train developers on secure coding.

controls.name: Secure Coding
controls.description: Secure coding principles shall be applied to software development.
controls.implementationGuidance: Follow OWASP guidelines. Implement input validation, output encoding, parameterized queries. Use security linters.

breachNotification.timeframe: Without undue delay (per A.5.24-26 and applicable laws)
breachNotification.threshold: Based on risk assessment and applicable legal requirements
